means: 担心( worry的过去式和过去分词)

sentence.Network_en: The Inspector remembered her as a small, mousy woman, invariably worried.
sentence.Network_cn: 检察官记得，她是一个矮小、羞怯、总是闷闷不乐的人。

sentence.Network_en: David was worried about major reorganisations taking place at work.
sentence.Network_cn: 戴维对工作上正在进行的重大重组很是忧虑。

sentence.Network_en: He was worried sick about what our mothers would say.
sentence.Network_cn: 对于我们双方的母亲会说什么他十分担心。

entry.def: When you are worried, you are unhappy because you keep thinking about problems that you have or about unpleasant things that might happen in the future.

example.ex: If you're at all worried about his progress, do discuss it with one of his teachers...
example.tran: 如果你还有一点儿担心他的学业的话，一定要找一位教他的老师谈一谈。

means.word_mean: 1. afflicted with or marked by anxious uneasiness or trouble or grief;

sentences.sentence: "one last worried check of the sleeping children"

auth_sentence.content: This is not the part I am worried about.
auth_sentence.res_content: This is not the part I am worried about.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: This is not the part I am worried about.

auth_sentence.content: I think everyone's worried about stability right now.
auth_sentence.res_content: I think everyone's worried about stability right now.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I think everyone's worried about stability right now.

auth_sentence.content: Of course, Time Warner isn't exactly worried.
auth_sentence.res_content: Of course, Time Warner isn't exactly worried.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Of course, Time Warner isn't exactly worried.

Sentence.sentence: Surveys show that the number of worried Americans has been steadily growing over the years as the computer becomes increasingly efficient, easier to operate, and less costly to purchase and maintain.
At first, people were worried about security.
I have an elderly mother and I'm worried about her going on a plane.
I'm not someone who's anti-technology, but I'm always worried that technology becomes an end in and of itself, and it replaces teaching or it replaces analysis.
What worried them most, in other words, was the fiscal (财政的) burden of immigration.
Why are American scholars worried about education today?

sentences.en: After twenty minutes I started to get worried.
sentences.cn: 20 分钟过去了，我开始担心起来。

sentences.en: He looked surprised, worried and angry by turn.
sentences.cn: 他看上去一会儿惊一会儿忧一会儿又怒。

sentences.en: Where have you been? I’ve been worried sick about you.
sentences.cn: 你去哪里了？我都快急出病了。

sentences.en: You had me worried for a moment—I thought you were going to resign!
sentences.cn: 你让我虛惊一场，我还以为你要辞职呢！
